question: [File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: filter_by_epoch()] [Iterator exhaustion] If the iterator panics during iteration, are partially filtered results still returned causing incomplete cleanup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_aug_data()] [Byzantine flooding] Can Byzantine validators (< 1/3) flood add_aug_data() with valid but excessive augmented data causing honest validators to exhaust resources processing and storing it? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_certified_aug_data()] [Certified data spamming] If Byzantine validators certify multiple different augmented data for the same author across multiple epochs, can the store be flooded with contradictory certified data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: new()] [Initialization race] Can Byzantine validators time their augmented data submissions to arrive during honest validator initialization, causing inconsistent AugDataStore states across the network? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Struct: AugDataStore] [Quorum manipulation] Does the code verify that certified_data has signatures from > 2/3 of validators by weight before accepting, or can minority-certified data be added? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: new()] [Epoch boundary race] During epoch transition, can validators racing to construct new AugDataStore instances process different subsets of augmented data due to database read timing? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: filter_by_epoch()] [Off-by-one epoch] Does filter_by_epoch() use != for comparison - can data from epoch+1 or epoch-1 slip through if there's an off-by-one in epoch tracking elsewhere? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: new()] [Stale config at epoch boundary] If config/fast_config contain keys from the previous epoch, can augment() calls add deltas to wrong epoch configurations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_aug_data()] [Epoch mismatch tolerance] The function signs with self.epoch but doesn't validate data.epoch() matches - can cross-epoch data be signed and accepted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_aug_data()] [Storage backend trust] The code trusts db.save_aug_data() to store correctly - can a malicious storage implementation silently corrupt or drop data causing consensus divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: new()] [Database key collision] If the database uses author as key without epoch, can data from different epochs collide and cause corruption when multiple epochs' stores access the same DB? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: new()] [Get-all performance] Calling db.get_all_aug_data() loads entire database - for long-running chains with many epochs, can this cause unacceptable initialization latency? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: new()] [Removal timing attack] Since remove operations happen after loading data, can a Byzantine node time database writes between load and remove to inject data into the store? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_aug_data()] [Signature computation DoS] Signing with self.signer.sign(&data) is expensive - can Byzantine validators force excessive signing operations by repeatedly submitting slightly different augmented data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_certified_aug_data()] [Augment computation DoS] The augment() call performs cryptographic operations (derive_apk) - can repeated certified data submissions exhaust CPU causing validator slowdown? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: new()] [Database scan DoS] Loading all aug_data and certified_aug_data on startup - can attackers populate database with millions of entries causing minutes-long initialization blocking consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: filter_by_epoch()] [Vector allocation DoS] Creating to_remove and to_keep vectors for all data - can excessive database entries cause memory allocation failures during filtering? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: get_my_aug_data()] [Identity mismatch] Does self.config.author() always match self.signer.author()? Can misconfiguration allow validators to use wrong identities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_aug_data()] [Author dereferencing] Using *data.author() for HashMap key - can this dereference fail or produce unexpected keys for malformed Author types? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_certified_aug_data()] [Multiple authors] If CertifiedAugData aggregate signature involves multiple signers but has single author field, can this be exploited to attribute data to wrong validator? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_aug_data()] [HashMap iteration order] If iteration order affects randomness generation and HashMap order is non-deterministic, can this cause validators to generate different random values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: new()] [Duplicate key handling] When constructing HashMaps from iterators with map(), can duplicate authors cause data loss where only last entry is kept? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Struct: AugDataStore] [HashMap capacity] Starting with default capacity - can gradual growth through repeated add operations cause performance degradation affecting consensus timing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: add_aug_data()] [Serialization for signing] The signer.sign(&data) serializes AugData - can malformed serialization produce different bytes for equivalent data bypassing equivocation detection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/rand/rand_gen/aug_data_store.rs] [Function: new()] [Deserialization from DB] Does database return properly typed AugData<D> or can type confusion in deserialization cause runtime errors or panics? (High)
